title: The Prefrontal Cortex and Willpower
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Prefrontal Cortex and Willpower usable.

hook.text: The brain region for self-control isn't fully developed until age 25. Teens aren't just being dramatic.

buildup.text: The prefrontal cortex manages decision-making, impulse control, planning, and social behavior.

discovery.text: It acts as the brain's CEOâ€”overriding impulses from the amygdala and reward system when needed.

twist.text: Willpower depletes with use. After resisting temptation all day, your prefrontal cortex literally runs low on glucose.

climax.text: This explains why people make worse decisions when tired, hungry, or stressedâ€”the CEO clocks out.

punchline.text: Self-control has a batteryâ€”and it drains.

quiz.question: Why do people make worse decisions when tired?
options: The prefrontal cortex runs low on energy to control impulses
Tiredness improves creativity at the expense of logic
The amygdala shuts down completely during fatigue
